lines.text:
[singing]
What is that?

[singing]
It's priest. Have a little priest.

[singing]
Is it really good?

[singing]
Sir, it's too good, at least. Then again, they don't commit sins of the flesh, so it's pretty fresh.

[singing]
Awful lot of fat.

[singing]
Only where it sat.

[singing]
Haven't you got... poet, or something like that?

[singing]
No, you see the trouble with poet is how do you know it's deceased... try the priest!

[singing]
There's a hole in the world like a great black pit/ And the vermin of the world inhabit it/ And its morals aren't worth what a pig could spit/ And it goes by the name of London.
Later on, when it's dark, we'll take him to some secret place and bury him.
Well, of course, we could do that. I don't suppose there's any relatives going to come poking around looking for him.
[pause, as an idea strikes her]

[singing]
But... You know me. Sometimes ideas just pop into me head and I keep thinking... Seems a downright shame...
Shame?

Seems an awful waste... Such a nice plump frame wot's-his-name has... had... Has... Nor it can't be traced. Business needs a lift - Debts to be erased - Think of it as thrift, as a gift... If you get my drift...
[Todd stares blankly]
No? Seems an awful waste. I mean, with the price of meat what it is, when you get it, IF you get it...

[Getting the idea]
Ha!
Good, you got it.

[singing]
For what's the sound of the world out there?

[singing]
What, Mr. Todd, what, Mr. Todd, what is that sound?

[singing]
Those crunching noises pervading the air?

[singing]
Yes, Mr. Todd, yes, Mr. Todd, yes, all around...

[singing]
It's man devouring man, my dear,

[singing]
And who are we to deny it in here?
Now then, this might be a bit stringy, but then of course it's a fiddle player!
No, no. This isn't fiddle player- it's PICCOLO player.
How can you tell?
It's PIPING hot.
Then BLOW on it first!
Since marine doesn't appeal to you, how about Rear Admiral?
No, no. It's too salty. I prefer... General.
With or without 'is privates? "With," is extra!
Lawyer's rather nice.
It is for a price.
Order something else, though, to follow since no one should swallow it twice.
Anything that's lean...
Well, then, if you're British and loyal, you might enjoy Royal Marine. Anyway, it's clean. Though, of course, it tastes of wherever it's been!
Is that squire on the fire?
Mercy, no sir, look closer, you'll notice it's grocer!
It looks thicker, more like vicar.
No, it has to be grocer - it's green!
It's fop. Finest in the shop. Or we have some shepherd's pie peppered with actual shepherd on top! And I've just begun - that's a politician so oily it's served with a doily, not one.
Put it on a bun. Well, you never know if it's going to run!

[singing]
What more can man require than love sir?

[singing]
More than love sir.

[singing]
What sir?

[singing]
Women.

[singing]
Ah yes, women.

[singing]
Pretty women.

[singing]
Mrs Mooney has a pie shop. Does a business, but I notice something weird - lately all her neighbour's cats have disappeared.

[singing, after Sweeney Todd has bitten into one of Mrs Lovett's pies]
Is that just disgusting? You have to conceed it. It's nothing but crusting, here drink this - you'll need it.
[first lines]

[singing]
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd. His skin was pale and his eye was odd. He shaved the faces of gentlemen who never thereafter were heard of again. He trod a path that few have trod, Did Sweeney Todd, the Demon Barber of Fleet Street.

[singing]
Swing your razor wide, Sweeney! Hold it to the skies! Freely flows the blood of those who moralize...

[singing]
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd...

[singing]
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd...

[singing]
He served a dark and a vengeful god...

[singing]
He served a dark and a vengeful god...

[singing]
What happened then? Well, that's the play and he wouldn't want us to give it away. Not Sweeney...

[singing]
Not Sweeney Todd... the demon barber of Fleet... Street.

[singing]
There was a barber and his wife, and she was beautiful. A foolish barber and his wife. She was his reason and his life, And she was beautiful. And she was virtuous. And he was - Naive. There was another man who saw that she was beautiful, a pious vulture of the law, who, with a gesture of his claw removed the barber from his plate. Then there was nothing but to wait and she would fall, so soft, so young, so lost, and oh, so beautiful!

[speaking]
And the lady, sir-did she-succumb?

[singing]
Oh, that was many years ago... I doubt if anyone would know.

[singing]
You there, my friend. Come, let me hold you. Now, with a sigh you grow warm in my hand, my friend, my clever friend. Rest now, my friends. Soon I'll unfold you. Soon you'll know splendors you never have dreamed all your days, my lucky friends. Till now your shine was merely silver. Friends you shall drip rubies...
[singing]
[simultaneously]

I'm your friend too, Mr. Todd. If you only knew, Mr. Todd - Ooh, Mr. Todd, you're warm in my hand. You've come home. Always had a fondness for you, I did. Never you fear, Mr. Todd, you can move in here, Mr. Todd. Splendors you never have dreamed All your days will be yours. I'm your friend. Don't they shine beautiful? Silver's good enough for me, Mr. T.

[singing]
You'll soon drip precious rubies...
[holds up his razor]

[singing]
At last, my right arm is complete again!

[singing]
Green finch and linnet bird, mightingale, blackbird, how is it you sing? how can you jubilate, sitting in cages, never taking wing? Outside the sky waits, beckoning, beckoning, just beyond the bars. How can you remain, staring at the rain, maddened by the stars?

[singing]
Hey! Hoy! Sailor boy! Want it snugly harbored? Open me gate, but dock it straight, I see it lists to starboard.
[Todd has engaged Pirelli in a shaving contest]

Now, signorini, signori, we mix-a da lather but first-a you gather around, signorini, signori, you looking a man who have had-a da glory to shave-a da Pope! Mr. Sweeney whoever - I beg-a you pardon-'ll probably say it was-a only a cardinal - Nope! It was-a da Pope!

[singing]
Ladies in their sensitivities, my lord, have a fragile sensibility. When a girl's emergent, probably it's urgent you defer to her gent- ility, my lord. Personal disorder cannot be ignored, given their genteel proclivities. Meaning no offense, it happens they resents it, ladies in their sensit - ivities, my lord.
Because the lives of the wicked should be- Made brief! For the rest of us, death will be a relief- We all deserve to die!

[singing]
No one's gonna hurt you, no one's gonna dare.

[singing]
I know what Toby deserves...

[singing]
Others can desert you... not to worry, whistle I'll be there.

[singing]
Here, have a nice bon-bon...

[singing]
Demons'll charm you with a smile, for a while, but in time... nothin' can harm you... not while I'm around.

[singing]
City on fire! Rats in the streets and the lunatics yelling at the moon! It's the end of the world - Yes! City on fire! Hunchbacks kissing! Stirrings in the graves and the screaming of giant winds! Watch out! Look! Crawling on the chimneys, great black crows screeching at the city on fire! City on fire! City on fire!
[Tobias has been driven mad]

[singing]
Pat-a-cake... pat-a-cake, baker man... bake me a cake... no, no... bake me a pie to delight my eye, and I will sigh if the crust be high...
[sees Todd, sobbing over the Beggar woman's body]
Mr. Todd... it's the old woman. You've harmed her too, haven't you? You shouldn't, you know... you shouldn't harm nobody...
[sees Todd's razor blade and picks it up]
Razor... razor... cut-cut-cut Cadougan, watch me grind my corn... pat him and prick him and mark him with a 'B... ' and put him in the oven... for baby and me...
[he cuts Todd's throat]

[singing]
Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, hugging the blade, waiting the years, hearing the music that nobody hears. Sweeney waits in the parlor hall, Sweeney leans on the office wall.

[singing]
No one can help! Nothing can hide you! Isn't that Sweeney there beside you?

[singing]
Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping, yes Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, is Sweeney, there he is! It's Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeny! Sweeny...
[they point all around the theatre]

[singing]
There! There! There! There! There! There! There! THERE!
[last lines]

[singing]
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd...

[singing]
Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd...

[singing]
He served a dark and a hungry god...

[singing]
He served a dark and a hungry god...

[singing]
To seek revenge may lead to Hell...

[singing]
But everyone does it, and seldom as well as Sweeney...

[singing]
As Sweeney Todd...

[singing]
The demon barber of Fleet... Street...

[singing]
Have charity towards the world, my pet.

[singing]
Yes, yes, I know, my love.

[singing]
We'll take the customers that we can get.

[singing]
High-born and and low, my love.

[singing]
We'll not discriminate great from small. No, we'll serve anyone...
[singing together]

[singing "By the Sea"]
All alone in our nest we could share our kippers / With the odd paying guest from the weekend trippers / With a nice sunny suite for the guests to rest in / Now and then, you could do a guest in / By the seeeeeeea...

[during a sit-down in the parlor]
There must be a way to the judge.
Bloody ol' judge, always harpin' on the bloody ol' judge. 'ere we've got a nice respectable business goin'!
You got any money? Listen to me! You got any money?
No money.
Then how you going to live even?
I'll live. If I have to sweat in the sewers or in the plague hospital, I'll live - and I'll have them!

All right! You, sir! How about a shave? Come and visit your good friend Sweeney! You sir, too sir? Welcome to the grave! I will have vengeance - I will have salvation! Who sir? You sir? No one in the chair, come on! Come on! Sweeney's waiting! I want you bleeders. Who sir? Anybody? Gentlemen, now don't be shy! Not one man, no! Nor ten men, nor a HUNDRED can assuage me! I will have YOU!
[laughs]
